title: Could roses help heal diabetic wounds? A new research paper finds out
description: Researchers from Shiv Nadar University, Delhi-NCR and IIT Bhilai have developed a hydrogel enriched with rose-derived extracellular vesicles and carbon dots, which has shown promise in treating diabetic wounds; if successful, this could be a cost-effective treatment for a growing health burden

description: Reddy highlights a summer in the lives of hill-grazing shepherds who navigate extreme wilderness for their livelihood

title: High-speed crash in Gurgaon: Five killed as Thar flips after hitting divider
description: Five occupants, including three females, died when their black Thar crashed into a divider and overturned near Jharsa chowk in Gurgaon early Saturday morning. The driver reportedly lost control due to high speed while traveling from Delhi to Gurgaon. All victims were declared dead at a local hospital following the tragic accident.

title: 'Menace to national security': Trump orders Microsoft to fire global affairs head
description: Donald Trump publicly demanded Microsoft fire Lisa Monaco, its president of global affairs, labeling her a "menace to US National Security." This action is part of his ongoing retribution campaign against officials who oversaw federal investigations into his conduct, including Monaco's role as former Deputy Attorney General coordinating the Jan 6 response. Trump had previously revoked her security clearance.

title: Historic! Sanju Samson breaks Dhoni’s record for most T20I sixes
description: Sanju Samson has now become India's leading T20I wicketkeeper in terms of sixes, surpassing MS Dhoni's record with 55 maximums. Despite adapting to different batting positions, he showcased his destructive power, contributing a vital 39 runs against Sri Lanka. His consistent ability to clear boundaries and adaptability make him a crucial asset for India's upcoming Asia Cup final.

description: India strongly rebutted Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s UN General Assembly address, labeling his remarks as "absurd theatrics" and accusing Pakistan of glorifying terrorism. Indian diplomat Petal Gahlot highlighted Pakistan's history of sheltering terrorists and its role in the Pahalgam attack. Sharif, conversely, accused India of unprovoked aggression, targeting civilians, and falsely claimed shooting down Indian jets.

description: Cardi B turned heads on "Call Her Daddy" by styling a custom Stefon Diggs jersey, simultaneously confirming her pregnancy with the NFL star. Expecting her fourth child, the rapper also vehemently dismissed bizarre breakup rumors, including claims about her BBL. She underscored her happiness and strong, supportive relationship with Diggs, navigating career demands and family growth.

title: Asia Cup: Jayasuriya hails Abhishek; slams loophole in cricket law after Super Over drama
description: Sri Lanka coach Sanath Jayasuriya lauded Abhishek Sharma’s fearless batting and Pathum Nissanka’s valiant century but raised concerns over “grey areas” in cricket laws after a controversial Super Over call. A caught-behind decision, later overturned, nullified a clear run-out, with the rule deeming the ball dead. Jayasuriya urged a review of such loopholes in the laws.

title: H3N2 flu cases rise in Delhi, doctors urge precaution
Asia Cup: Injury scare for India? Bowling coach shares updates on Abhishek Sharma, Pandya
description: India had an injury scare as Hardik Pandya and Abhishek Sharma left the field during the Sri Lanka clash, but bowling coach Morne Morkel confirmed both suffered only cramps. While Hardik will be reassessed before the Pakistan final, Abhishek is fit. Morkel admitted India haven’t played a “complete game” yet and stressed sharper execution across departments.

title: Travis Kelce rumoured to star in Taylor Swift’s 'The Fate of Ophelia' video
description: Taylor Swift fans are speculating Travis Kelce will appear in her "The Fate of Ophelia" music video, fueled by a lip-read comment from a behind-the-scenes clip. Theories suggest Swift wants "him" in the video, potentially rewriting Ophelia's tragic story to incorporate her real-life romance. The highly anticipated video premieres October 3.

title: Delhi govt to waive off late payment surcharge on water bills: Minister

description: U.S. Special Envoy Steve Witkoff said U.S. Predsident Trump presented proposals to those leaders that included a 21-point Middle East peace plan

Asia Cup: 'If anyone speaks against India, I will...'- Yograj Singh warns Pak ahead of final
description: Former India pacer Yograj Singh strongly condemned the on-field spat between Indian and Pakistani players during the Asia Cup Super Fours. He fiercely defended young Indian batters Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill, blaming Pakistan pacers for initiating verbal abuse. Singh's comments intensify the already charged rivalry ahead of the Asia Cup final.

title: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha announces re-opening of 12 tourist spots closed after Pahalgam attack
description: An official said out of 12 tourist spots thrown open, five are in the Jammu division and seven in the Kashmir division.

title: 'Dirty cop': Trump lauds FBI’s Kash Patel for Comey indictment; labels him 'total slimeball'
description: US President Donald Trump praised FBI director Kash Patel and the agency for the recent indictment of former FBI chief James Comey, whom he called a "dirty cop." Comey faces charges of false statements and obstructing Congress, which he denies. Since returning to office, Trump has reportedly used his powers to target opponents, suggesting more indictments are forthcoming.

description: CM Mann noted that contributions through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) could not be made to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, and even Members of Parliament can donate a maximum of 20 lakh to it.

FIFA suspends seven Malaysian players over forged documents
description: World football's disciplinary committee imposed the sanctions after the Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) doctored documentation to be able to field the players in a 4-0 win over Vietnam in June, it said in a statement.

title: Epstein files: Musk appears in newly released papers; possible island visit in 2014
description: Elon Musk's name appeared in the Jeffrey Epstein files. Other prominent figures like Prince Andrew and Peter Thiel are also mentioned. Democratic lawmakers released these documents. They show possible interactions between Epstein and these individuals. Musk may have visited Epstein's island in 2014. This was after Epstein was a registered sex offender. The revelations raise new questions.

title: India-US deal could involve a grand bargain on oil: New Jersey Governor

description: Harry Kane has scored his 99th and 100th goals for Bayern Munich in his 104th game for the German champion as Bayern won 4-0 against Werder Bremen

title: Punjab: Mann blames IMD for off-mark predictions, says Opp playing politics instead of helping state
Punjab: Bajwa demands dismissal of Water Resources Minister, suspension of secy
‘We have sharp eyes’: Gurgaon cop stalks digital creator using her car number
description: A Gurgaon police constable was suspended and an FIR registered after he used official channels to trace a 50-year-old digital creator's car registration. Finding her "attractive," he tracked her Instagram, commenting on her movements and admitting his identity, deeply disturbing the woman who later filed a complaint. Police took action after her video went viral.

title: In rare rebuke, federal officials discipline ICE officer for shoving woman in New York
description: The altercation, which was captured on videos that spread quickly on social media, unfolded after the woman's husband was arrested at an immigration court in New York City

title: Makena White death: How Jake Knapp’s girlfriend died at 28
description: PGA Tour golfer Jake Knapp's girlfriend, Makena White, passed away suddenly at 28. A friend shared the news on Instagram. Makena was from Ottawa, Canada. She graduated from McMaster University. She worked in surgical sales. Makena and Jake began dating in August 2023. They went public after his Mexico Open win. The golf world expressed shock and sadness.

title: Giving warriors a fighting chance: Where personnel injured in line of duty are trained to become para-athletes and IT professionals
description: In 2020, the National Centre for Divyang Empowerment was established as an exclusive facility for training CAPF personnel who suffer injuries and become physically challenged in the line of duty. In five years, the centre has trained 219 ‘Divyang warriors’, producing medal-winning para-athletes and IT professionals. Vijaita Singh and Naveen Kumar report on how the facilities on campus give the injured a new lease of life

title: Voter registered in multiple seats can't contest polls: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court today ruled that candidates registered as voters in multiple constituencies are barred from contesting elections. Dismissing the Uttarakhand SEC's appeal, the apex court upheld the High Court's stay on a circular that permitted such candidates in panchayat polls, deeming it contrary to statutory provisions.

title: Ukraine says Russia drone incursion part of pressure plan against West
description: Russia denies it planned to target anything in Poland with drones as it was attacking neighbouring Ukraine.

title: Two Kerala students allege assault by Delhi police personnel
description: Denying allegations of theft, they say police officers brutally assaulted them, forced them to speak in Hindi and ridiculed them for wearing lungi; MP John Brittas seeks impartial probe into ‘custodial brutality’

title: 'Man of peace': At UNGA, Sharif backs Trump's claim of mediation
description: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif delivered a bizarre UN speech, falsely claiming victory over India and praising Trump for a ceasefire. Meanwhile, Trump's new 100% tariff on imported branded drugs has unsettled markets, raising concerns for India's $10bn pharma exports, especially if branded generics are included, prompting a search for new markets.

title: Federal agents fire chemicals as protesters try to block car at immigration site outside Chicago
description: Agents repeatedly fired chemical agents toward a crowd of over 100 protesters after some of the group attempted to block a car from driving down a street toward the ICE building on Friday

title: Horoscope Today for 27 September, 2025: Key Astrological Trends Affecting Gemini, Capricorn, Libra, Leo, and Other Zodiac Signs
India rejects as baseless Nato chief's claim PM Modi quizzed Putin on war
description: MEA strongly refuted Nato chief Mark Rutte's claims that PM Modi questioned Russian President Putin about his Ukraine strategy due to US tariffs. The MEA asserted no such conversation occurred, urging Nato for greater accuracy in public statements. India continues its discounted Russian oil imports, defending them as vital for national economic security.

title: Tehran, Moscow sign $25 billion deal to build nuclear plants in Iran
description: Iran has just one operational nuclear power plant in Bushehr in the south, with a capacity of 1,000 megawatts — just a fraction of the country's energy needs

title: Supreme Court does U-turn, validates JSW takeover of Bhushan Steel
description: The Supreme Court reversed its earlier decision, reinstating JSW Steel's revival plan for bankrupt Bhushan Power and Steel Limited. This ruling allows JSW to continue transforming BPSL into a profitable entity after a significant Rs 20,000 crore investment, upholding the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code's objectives and the Committee of Creditors' commercial wisdom.

title: DRDO wins businessline’s Changemaker of the Year Award for its strategic technology
description: The Azim Premji Foundation won the Iconic Changemaker Award for its pioneering and extensive work in education and healthcare

title: India, Russia agree to boost farm trade
description: India and Russia agreed to significantly increase agricultural trade and strengthen bilateral cooperation following a meeting between Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Russian Deputy PM Dmitry Patrushev. Discussions focused on enhancing agricultural ties, with Russia expressing keen interest in formalizing a partnership through a Memorandum of Understanding. Chouhan highlighted international collaboration for farmer welfare and food security.

title: Indian junior women's hockey team loses 2-3 against Australia
description: Lalthantluangi (47th minute) and Sonam (54th) were the scorers for India, while Bianca Zurrer (36th), Evie Sransby (45th) and Sammy Love (59th) struck for Australia

title: After Operation Sindoor, LeT moves deep into Pakistan
description: UN-designated terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba is relocating its operational and training infrastructure deeper into Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa to evade Indian strikes. Satellite imagery confirms a new facility, Markaz Jihad-e-Aqsa, is under construction in Lower Dir, 47km from the Afghan border, replacing a hub destroyed by the Indian Army. Key masterminds have been assigned leadership and instructional roles at this new site.

title: Violence following Dera chief conviction: Courts cannot ‘abdicate’, warns amicus
Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt stuns in Dolce & Gabbana ahead of Ravens game
description: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently shared highlights from her lavish New York City trip, featuring her boyfriend Derek Green and parents. She also discussed how her family keeps her grounded, emphasizing faith, family, football, and philanthropy, alongside her long-standing relationship with Green, whom she has known since childhood.

title: Stakeholder panel to decide future of HC premises: Chief Justice Sheel Nagu suggested weekly meetings of the panel headed by a sitting judge, beginning with the first on October 9
Jake Knapp’s girlfriend Makena White dies at 28, Golf World pays tribute
description: The golf world mourned the sudden death of Makena White. She was 28 years old and the girlfriend of PGA Tour golfer Jake Knapp. Her friend confirmed her passing on Instagram. Tributes poured in from fans and golf figures. Makena supported Knapp during his career highlights. She was with him for his first PGA Tour win.

title: Trump told Zelenskyy he was open to providing new long-range weapons
OIL confirms natural gas find in Andaman sea
description: Oil India Ltd has definitively established the presence of natural gas in the Andaman Sea for the first time, marking a significant find at the Sri Vijayapuram-II well. Initial testing confirmed natural gas with 87% methane, leading the oil minister to express hopes for a "Guyana-scale discovery.

title: UN Security Council rejects Russia and China's last-ditch effort to delay sanctions on Iran
description: The resolution put forth by Russia and China — Iran's most powerful and closest allies on the 15-member council — failed to garner support on Friday

title: Rahul backs students protesting over paper  leak in Uttarakhand,  calls BJP ‘paper chor’
Delhi HC lets Priya file Sunjay's assets list in sealed cover
description: Delhi High Court permitted Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit her late husband Sunjay Kapur's asset list in a sealed cover. This concerns a suit filed by Sunjay's children from his marriage with Karisma Kapoor. The court also ensured lawyers would not discuss the case publicly. A copy of Sunjay's will goes to his mother.

title: Your suit is not maintainable in Delhi, HC tells Sameer Wankhede
description: Delhi HC questioned the maintainability of IRS officer Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against the Netflix series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. Wankhede seeks an injunction for his alleged misleading portrayal, but the court specifically asked if the cause of action arose in Delhi. This query came despite arguments that the series was viewed and reactions emerged from the city.

title: India cites Trump, flags EU double standards
description: India firmly rejected EU concerns over its Russian oil imports, highlighting US President Trump's criticism of European nations for their continued energy purchases from Russia. New Delhi asserted there cannot be double standards on the matter, even as EU officials ruled out sanctions against India.

title: Sonam Wangchuk detained under NSA & shifted to Jodhpur: Ladakh administration
description: Time and again, it has been observed that Wangchuk has been indulging in activities prejudicial to the security of the state and detrimental to maintenance of peace and public order and services essential to the community, the Directorate of Information & Public Relations (DIPR), Ladakh said in a statement here.

title: Gisele Bündchen reveals why she left Leonardo DiCaprio after years together
description: Gisele Bundchen, post-divorce from Tom Brady, reflects on her past high-profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio, revealing it ended due to differing life paths. She also recalls meeting Brady, whom she married in 2009 before their 2022 divorce. Bundchen now lives a comfortable life with her new boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.

description: In April this year, the tribunal formed a three-member committee headed by a retired district judge, after an applicant raised allegations of illegal felling of trees.

title: Did Adele turn down 2026 Super Bowl? Here’s what’s happening
description: Conflicting reports surround Adele's potential 2026 Super Bowl halftime show. While some outlets claim she declined the offer, possibly due to security concerns, others maintain active negotiations with the NFL and Roc Nation are ongoing. This isn't Adele's first Super Bowl consideration, having rejected a 2016 offer. Fans eagerly await official confirmation as her status remains firmly "to be determined."

description: The researchers have essentially carried out modification of desert sand into soil using polymers for reaping its full agricultural potential

title: Not a med emergency: Generic pharma cos spared from harm
description: Trump's new 100% pharma levy primarily targets branded and patented medicines, potentially impacting Sun Pharma and Biocon's US sales. While most Indian generic firms anticipate business as usual, some may shift high-value production to US facilities or diversify markets.

title: U.S. rejects WHO non-communicable diseases declaration: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

description: India's iconic MiG-21 warbird completed its final flight from Chandigarh after six decades of service. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh presided over the decommissioning, hailing it as a transformative symbol of India's air power and its strategic partnership with Russia. He praised its versatility across multiple roles, establishing India's global air power.

title: Asia Cup 2025 Ind vs SL | Nissanka special in vain as Arshdeep helps the Men in Blue prevail in Super Over

5 ancient breathing techniques to lower blood pressure and boost heart and lung health
description: Pranayama is an ancient yogic practice that focuses controlled breathing to balance mind and body. Ancient breathing techniques or Pranayama, have proven to reduce cortisol levels, regulate the autonomic nervous system, and improve heart rate variability. Beyond physiological benefits, breathing techniques have emerged as simple yet powerful tools to restore balance, clarity, and inner calm.

title: D Raja seeks full statehood for J&K, Delhi and Puducherry
Explained: Why was Shanaka given not out even after getting 'out'?
description: In a dramatic Asia Cup Super Over, Sri Lanka's Dasun Shanaka survived a clear run-out due to a cricket law technicality. After being given out caught behind, which he reviewed, Shanaka was run out while the ball was deemed "dead" by the umpire's initial decision. DRS overturned the caught-behind, but Law 20 protected him, baffling players.

description: According to ED, Raj Kundra has deliberately concealed crucial evidence, including the Bitcoin wallet addresses, etc and failed to surrender the Bitcoins received from Bhardwaj

title: Asia Cup | Nissanka’s blazing century in vain; IND edge SL in Super Over
description: Pathum Nissanka’s maiden T20I century (107 off 58) went in vain as India overcame Sri Lanka in a dramatic Super Over to maintain their unbeaten run in the Asia Cup. Earlier, Abhishek Sharma (61) and Sanju Samson (39) powered India to 202/5, the tournament’s highest total, before Sri Lanka’s late push dragged the contest into a tense finish.

title: Stalin inaugurates civic amenities set up at cost of ₹41.83 crore
description: The projects include upgraded sports facilities at Bharathidasan Stadium in Shenoy Nagar and amenities at parks in Koyambedu and Ramapuram

on September 29

title: CEO of Hong Kong firm alleges ₹15-crore cargo fraud
description: B. Subramanyan says the Container Freight Station in Vallur near Kattupalli Port unlawfully released his company goods to the importers without the original bills of lading or valid Delivery Orders; he alleges that his subsequent inquiries had revealed a larger conspiracy involving 21 individuals, including representatives of the import firms, shipping companies, and officials of the freight station

title: New Epstein documents have names of Elon Musk, Peter Thiel, Bill Gates and Prince Andrew
Rajasthan horror: Newborn found with mouth glued, buried alive under stones in forest
description: Police in Bhilwara arrested an unmarried woman and her father for burying her 20-day-old newborn under stones with glue in his mouth to conceal an illegal birth. A shepherd discovered the infant, leading to a prompt police rescue and hospital admission.

description: Bangladesh's interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus faced protests at the UNGA in New York, where Sheikh Hasina's supporters accused him of bias and poor governance. Critics allege his administration allowed attacks on minorities and strained ties with India by blaming them for hosting Hasina. Yunus addressed the UN on Bangladesh's post-uprising journey.

Ladakhi organizations planned further talks with the MHA committee.

description: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.

title: Prostate cancer and back pain: What’s real and what’s misleading
description: Prostate cancer incidence in the US shows a concerning rise, particularly in advanced stages. While early prostate cancer often lacks symptoms, back pain can be a sign of metastasis to the bones, especially the spine. However, most back pain is unrelated to cancer, stemming from muscle strains or other issues.

title: Silicon Valley Billionaire warns: H-1B policy may backfire; Indian engineers at risk
description: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.
